alert.note: Alert for Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 5:44AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Minnesota... Mississippi River at Wabasha affecting Buffalo and Wabasha Counties. Mississippi River at Winona affecting Buffalo, Trempealeau and Winona Counties. Mississippi River at Lake City affecting Goodhue, Pepin and Wabasha Counties. Mississippi River at La Crosse affecting Vernon, La Crosse and Houston Counties. Wisconsin River at Castle Rock Dam affecting Adams and Juneau Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Winona. * WHEN...From Sunday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Some railroad lines may become inoperative. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning and continue rising to 18.3 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.3 feet on 04/11/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM CDT.
